xwikidoc.name: ccmArchive20130525
xwikidoc.creator: XWiki.sdumitriu
xwikidoc.author: XWiki.sdumitriu
xwikidoc.title: IRC Archive for channel #ccm on 25 May 2013
xwikidoc.content: <BogdanVancea> has joined #ccm 05:31 <sdumitriu> Hey BogdanVancea 05:31 <sdumitriu> Will you be around later? 05:55 <BogdanVancea> hello 05:55 <BogdanVancea> yes 05:55 <BogdanVancea> I'll be around all day 08:36 <krinye> has joined #ccm 08:36 <krinye> hi guys 08:40 <BogdanVancea> hello 08:46 <krinye> hi Bogdan, any news on GSOC? I have seen you here a couple of times 08:46 <krinye> how is your project going? What are you working on? 08:47 <BogdanVancea> the accepted projects haven't been announced yet 08:47 <BogdanVancea> :) 08:47 <BogdanVancea> I applied for add a Solr backend to Medsavant 08:48 <BogdanVancea> and you? 08:48 <krinye> cool, which University are you from Toronto by any chance? 08:49 <BogdanVancea> no, I am a student at the Technical University of Cluj Napoca 08:49 <BogdanVancea> in Romania 08:49 <BogdanVancea> so, quite far from Toronto 08:49 <BogdanVancea> :) 08:49 <krinye> lol far indeed : ) 08:50 <BogdanVancea> yeah 08:50 <krinye> I am working or hope to work on Mobile application for chronic disease management 08:50 <BogdanVancea> ah, cool 08:51 <BogdanVancea> Android? 08:51 <krinye> Yes, Android 08:52 <BogdanVancea> nice 08:52 <BogdanVancea> are you a student in Toronto? 08:53 <krinye> yes, University of Toronto Computer Science. 08:53 <krinye> How is the tech/startup community or culture in Romania? 08:53 <BogdanVancea> hm 08:53 <BogdanVancea> it's definitely growing 08:54 <BogdanVancea> we have a couple of technical groups 08:54 <BogdanVancea> meeting a couple times a month 08:54 <BogdanVancea> and there's a google developer group 08:54 <BogdanVancea> very focused on creating a nice environment for start-ups 08:55 <BogdanVancea> everything evolved a lot in the last 2 years or so 08:55 <BogdanVancea> how about the Toronto area? 08:59 <krinye> Its growing quite rapidly getting alot of students working on projects really exciting stuff 09:00 <krinye> Google seems to have set up a center as well in waterloo near the University of Waterloo, in toronto there are mostly incubators and such looking for the next big thing 09:01 <krinye> Anyways I gotta go in a bit but best of luck in GSOC! 09:01 <BogdanVancea> thanks 09:01 <BogdanVancea> good luck to you too! 09:23 <sdumitriu> Hello 09:24 <sdumitriu> BogdanVancea: Still around? 09:24 <BogdanVancea> hello, sdumitriu 09:24 <BogdanVancea> yes, still around 09:25 <sdumitriu> So, I had a question about your job 09:25 <sdumitriu> You know that GSoC is supposed to be a full time thing, right? 09:26 <BogdanVancea> yes, I do 09:27 <BogdanVancea> and it will, if I get accepted :) 09:28 <sdumitriu> Yes, we'll see about that... 09:28 <sdumitriu> You think you will? 09:28 <BogdanVancea> I'm not sure 09:29 <BogdanVancea> I'm 50-50 % 09:29 <BogdanVancea> I'm very excited to work in an open source environment 09:29 <BogdanVancea> however, there are a lot of things I need to learn 09:30 <BogdanVancea> technical skills and personal skills 09:31 <BogdanVancea> I feel like I've learned a lot from the task I've been given, however, there were a lot of slip-ups 09:31 <BogdanVancea> and I don't think those are in my advantage 09:31 <sdumitriu> It's OK 09:31 <sdumitriu> You're still a student 09:32 <BogdanVancea> that's true 09:33 <BogdanVancea> but one can always improve 09:33 <BogdanVancea> :) 09:35 <sdumitriu> Yes, and that's also one of the goals of GSoC 09:35 <sdumitriu> Improving your coding skills and meta-skills 09:37 <BogdanVancea> yes, that's why I decided to apply 09:39 <BogdanVancea> is the fact that I am currently employed a disadvantage for me? 09:40 <sdumitriu> A bit, yes 09:41 <BogdanVancea> I see 09:42 <BogdanVancea> I thought it might be like that 09:42 <BogdanVancea> :) 09:50 <BogdanVancea> I did, however, want to give it a try :) 09:50 <sdumitriu> Yes, we'll see 09:51 <sdumitriu> A little more than 29 hours left until the announcements 09:52 <sdumitriu> Ah, no 09:52 <sdumitriu> Forgot it's Saturday 09:52 <sdumitriu> So, more than two days... 09:52 <BogdanVancea> I just checked a couple of mins ago 09:52 <sdumitriu> Ah, the suspense... 09:52 <BogdanVancea> yes, 2 days 09:52 <BogdanVancea> ;)) 09:53 <BogdanVancea> tbh, it is 09:54 <BogdanVancea> 'm not sure how it works tho 09:54 <BogdanVancea> do the organizations decided and gsoc staff just approves? 09:54 <BogdanVancea> decide* 09:55 <sdumitriu> No, organizations do everything 09:55 <BogdanVancea> ah, I see 09:55 <sdumitriu> Except decide how many slots they get 09:55 <sdumitriu> Google distributes the slots 09:55 <BogdanVancea> makes more sense that way 09:55 <sdumitriu> So yeah, I already know who's going to be accepted 09:55 <sdumitriu> Just toying with you 09:56 <BogdanVancea> ;)) 09:56 <BogdanVancea> I see 09:56 <BogdanVancea> can you tell me how many students will be accepted? 09:56 <BogdanVancea> for ccm 09:57 <sdumitriu> 5 09:57 <BogdanVancea> quite a few 09:57 <sdumitriu> Yes, a handful 09:58 <BogdanVancea> =)) 09:58 <BogdanVancea> nice pun 09:59 <BogdanVancea> and how about xwiki? 09:59 <sdumitriu> Just 1 09:59 <BogdanVancea> you said you're a mentor there aswell 09:59 <BogdanVancea> oh 09:59 <sdumitriu> The quality of the proposals was terrible 09:59 <sdumitriu> If it were after me, I wouldn't have accepted that one either 10:00 <BogdanVancea> ah 10:00 <ravigarg27> has joined #ccm 10:00 <sdumitriu> Hey Ravi 10:00 <BogdanVancea> hello :) 10:01 <sdumitriu> Anyway, that was for the better, since I moved the extra slots to CCM 10:01 <sdumitriu> Being admin for two orgs has its advantages 10:01 <sdumitriu> (CCM had 2 initially) 10:02 <BogdanVancea> ah, I see 10:02 <ravigarg27> hii sdumitriu1 10:02 <BogdanVancea> and xwiki 4 10:02 <sdumitriu> Yes 10:02 <sdumitriu> First timers always get very few slots 10:03 <sdumitriu> XWiki asked between 2 and 4, and got 4 10:03 <sdumitriu> CCM asked between 5 and 9, and got 2 10:03 <sdumitriu> How is that fair? 10:03 <BogdanVancea> wow 10:03 <BogdanVancea> I think it solely because it was the first year 10:03 <BogdanVancea> for ccm 10:04 <BogdanVancea> it's* 10:04 <sdumitriu> Yes 10:04 <sdumitriu> Although we did say several times that we're actually veterans forming a new organization 10:04 <sdumitriu> But when you have to review 500 organizations, you can't remember the details for everyone 10:05 <BogdanVancea> so you, marta and mark were all previous mentors? 10:05 <sdumitriu> Yes 10:05 <BogdanVancea> nice 10:06 <BogdanVancea> for how many years? 10:06 <sdumitriu> Me and Marta started as students back in 2005 10:06 <sdumitriu> I've been mentor since 2007 10:06 <BogdanVancea> wow, you're really a veteran 10:07 <ravigarg27> 6 years nice :) 10:07 <sdumitriu> Marc I think started three years ago, mentoring for NRNB 10:08 <sdumitriu> When evaluating students, I have to keep reminding myself what a lousy application I wrote in my first year 10:08 <sdumitriu> But things were different, being the first edition there was a complete lack of organization 10:08 <sdumitriu> There were no guides 10:09 <sdumitriu> No application templates to let students know what they should fill in 10:09 <sdumitriu> I would simply discard my application as span now 10:09 <sdumitriu> spam 10:09 <BogdanVancea> I see :)) 10:10 <BogdanVancea> its only normal that standards rise 10:10 <sdumitriu> Yes 10:10 <BogdanVancea> what did you work on in your first year? 10:11 <sdumitriu> http://www.drdobbs.com/googles-summer-of-code-part-ii/184406383#0601ds4 10:12 <BogdanVancea> nice 10:12 <BogdanVancea> so you've been involved with xwiki 10:12 <BogdanVancea> from the start 10:16 <sdumitriu> Ah, I have to set up an anti-spam solution for phenotips.org.... 10:17 <BogdanVancea> what type of spam? 10:19 <sdumitriu> Well, spam bots now start by writing "flattering" comments, and then a few days later start posting links 10:19 <sdumitriu> I delete that the next day, but it's still bad 10:20 <sdumitriu> I left an open demo on phenotips.org so that people interested in the project can quickly test it without having to register 10:20 <sdumitriu> But now spambots found the site and abuse it 10:22 <BogdanVancea> ugh, nasty problem 10:46 <sdumitriu> ravigarg27: Do you want to learn some CSS and JS the hard way? 10:46 <ravigarg27> yeah sure 10:47 <sdumitriu> https://github.com/sdumitriu/frontend-tests/ 10:48 <ravigarg27> ok thanks :) 11:39 <sdumitriu> has joined #ccm 12:49 <ravigarg27> has joined #ccm 14:07 <sdumitriu> ravigarg27: Enjoying the tests? 14:08 <ravigarg27> umm sry still not started will start from tomorrow 14:08 <sdumitriu> K 14:10 <ravigarg27> can you please explain where I am doing wrong in that code 14:10 <ravigarg27> I dont seem to get it 14:12 <ravigarg27> its like more the maxScore more similar are the strings right? 14:22 <sdumitriu> Yes 14:24 <ravigarg27> umm then what am I missing? 14:26 <sdumitriu> The naming of things 14:26 <sdumitriu> The name of a variable or a method is very important 14:32 <ravigarg27> ohh so the logic is correct right? 14:44 <ravigarg27> I have changed the variables name you suggested 14:47 <ravigarg27> and also the method 15:37 <kushalkhandelwal> has joined #ccm 15:57 <kushalkhandelwal> has joined #ccm
